snippet: The case has provoked a debate over how to handle returning jihadists without discouraging their families from cooperating with the authorities.
abstract: Mohammed Ahmed and Yusuf Sarwar, British citizens who fought in Syria, are both sentenced to 12 year prison terms; men were arrested in January upon their return to Great Britain for acts of terrorism after their families cooperated with police; case has incited debate over how to reduce risk posed by returning jihadists without discouraging families from cooperating with authorities.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and MELISSA EDDY
byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from London, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The case has provoked a debate over how to handle returning jihadists without discouraging their families from cooperating with the authorities.

headline.main: Britain Puts 2 in Prison After Return From Syria
headline.print_headline: Britain Puts 2 in Prison After Return From Syria

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
